Articles.Content: How do you train up your Kerbals for the few few levels? do you have a certain regime?

Best routine I've used is as follows:

Low Kerbal Orbit

Mun Orbit

Minmus Landing/Flag Planting

Pop outside Kerbin's SOI for a brief second

Return to KSC

This will bring your Kerbs up to Level 3 (beyond that, levels are irrelevant)

Landing on Minmus instead of Mun saves dV.

Scientist's buffs cap at Level 4. HOWEVER, that's irrelevant because you can only get a Kerbal to level 4 by returning him from the SOI of another planet. Which means you'll have finished the stock tech tree before then, at which point scientists become redundant. Now, if you've tweaked the tech tree somehow, or have weird-science mods that add teirs, then you still need science and there's a point in having high-level scientists out among the other planets. But otherwise, no.

Pilots are redundant after you get a probe core that has SAS. Scientists are useless once the tech tree is done. Engineers, however, are always useful and level 5 engineers get buffs to mining.

Regarding training, I found out that flag planting gives no more experience than simply landing on the body (at least in 1.0.2). No need to flag spam. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
